de.icongmbh.oss.maven.plugin.javassist

Class JavassistTransformerExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.icongmbh.oss.maven.plugin.javassist.JavassistTransformerExecutor

  • public class JavassistTransformerExecutor
extends Object
    Executor to perform the transformation by a list of IClassTransformer instances.
    Since:
    1.1.0

      • setOutputDirectory

        public void setOutputDirectory(String outputDirectory)
        Sets the output directory where the transformed classes will stored.

        The configured input directory will used if this directory is null or empty.

        Parameters:
        outputDirectory - could be null or empty.
        See Also:

      • getOutputDirectory

        Returns:
        maybe null or empty

      • setInputDirectory

        public void setInputDirectory(String inputDirectory)
        Sets the input directory where the classes to transform will selected from.

        Nothing will transformed if this directory is null or empty.

        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - could be null or empty.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Executes all configured IClassTransformer.
        See Also:
        setTransformerClasses(IClassTransformer...), execute(IClassTransformer)

      • execute

        protected void execute(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer)
        Execute transformation with passed IClassTransformer.

        This method uses getInputDirectory() and getOutputDirectory() and calls transform(IClassTransformer, String, String).

        If the passed transformer is null nothing will transformed.

        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer that will apply transformations could be null.
        See Also:
        getInputDirectory(), getOutputDirectory(), transform(IClassTransformer, String, String)

      • transform

        public final void transform(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                            String directory)
        Search for class files on the passed directory name (iterateClassnames(String)) and apply transformation to each one ( transform(IClassTransformer, String, String, Iterator)).

        Limitation: do not search inside .jar files.

        If the passed transformer is null or the passed directory is null or empty nothing will transformed.

        Parameters:
        transformer - the transformer that will apply transformations could be null.
        directory - could be null or empty. The input and output directory are the same.
        See Also:
        iterateClassnames(String), transform(IClassTransformer, String, String, Iterator)

      • transform

        public void transform(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                      String inputDir,
                      String outputDir)
        Search for class files on the passed input directory (iterateClassnames(String)) and apply transformation to each one ( transform(IClassTransformer, String, String, Iterator)).

        Limitation: do not search inside .jar files.

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations could be null.
        inputDir - The root directory where the classes to transform will selected from could be null or empty. If it is null or empty nothing will be transformed.
        outputDir - The output directory where the transformed classes will stored could be null or empty. If it is null or empty the inputDir will be used.
        See Also:
        iterateClassnames(String), transform(IClassTransformer, String, String, Iterator)

      • transform

        public final void transform(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                            String inputDir,
                            String outputDir,
                            Iterator<String> classNames)
        Transform each class passed via Iterator of class names.

        Use the passed className iterator, load each one as CtClass, filter the valid candidates and apply transformation to each one.

        Limitation: do not search inside .jar files.

        Any unexpected (internal catched) Exception will be re-thrown in an RuntimeException.

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations could be null.
        inputDir - The root directory where the classes to transform will selected from could be null or empty. If it is null or empty nothing will be transformed.
        outputDir - The output directory where the transformed classes will stored could be null or empty. If it is null or empty the inputDir will be used.
        classNames - could be null or empty. If it is null or empty nothing will be transformed.
        See Also:
        initializeClass(ClassPool, CtClass), IClassTransformer.shouldTransform(CtClass), IClassTransformer.applyTransformations(CtClass)

      • evaluateOutputDirectory

        protected String evaluateOutputDirectory(String outputDir,
                                         String inputDir)
        Evaluates and returns the output directory.

        If the passed outputDir is null or empty, the passed inputDir otherwise the outputDir will returned.

        Parameters:
        outputDir - could be null or empty
        inputDir - must not be null
        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed inputDir is null
        Since:
        1.2.0

        Returns:
        never null
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • configureClassPool

        protected javassist.ClassPool configureClassPool(javassist.ClassPool classPool,
                                                 String inputDir)
                                          throws javassist.NotFoundException
        Configure the passed instance of a ClassPool and append required class pathes on it.
        Parameters:
        classPool - must not be null
        inputDir - must not be null
        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        javassist.NotFoundException - if passed classPool is null or if passed inputDir is a JAR or ZIP and not found.
        NullPointerException - if passed inputDir is null
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • iterateClassnames

        protected Iterator<String> iterateClassnames(String directory)
        Search for class files (file extension: .class) on the passed directory.

        Note: The passed directory name must exist and readable.

        Parameters:
        directory - must nor be null
        Returns:
        iterator of full qualified class names and never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed directory is null.
        See Also:
        SuffixFileFilter, TrueFileFilter, FileUtils.iterateFiles(File, IOFileFilter, IOFileFilter), ClassnameExtractor.iterateClassnames(File, Iterator)

      • applyStamp

        protected void applyStamp(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                          javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                   throws javassist.CannotCompileException
        Apply a "stamp" to a class to indicate it has been modified.

        By default, this method uses a boolean field named "__TRANSFORMED_BY_JAVASSIST_MAVEN_PLUGIN__" as the stamp. Any class overriding this method should also override hasStamp(IClassTransformer, CtClass).

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations must not be null.
        candidateClass - the class to mark/stamp must not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed candidateClass is null.
        javassist.CannotCompileException - by CtClass.addField(CtField, CtField.Initializer)
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        createStampField(IClassTransformer, CtClass), CtClass.addField(CtField, CtField.Initializer)

      • removeStamp

        protected void removeStamp(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                           javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                    throws javassist.CannotCompileException
        Remove a "stamp" from a class if the "stamp" field is available.

        By default, this method removes a boolean field named "__TRANSFORMED_BY_JAVASSIST_MAVEN_PLUGIN__". Any class overriding this method should also override hasStamp(IClassTransformer, CtClass).

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations must not be null.
        candidateClass - the class to remove the mark/stamp from must not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed candidateClass is null.
        javassist.CannotCompileException - by CtClass.removeField(CtField)
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        createStampField(IClassTransformer, CtClass), CtClass.removeField(CtField)

      • hasStamp

        protected boolean hasStamp(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                           javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
        Indicates whether a class holds a stamp or not.

        By default, this method uses a boolean field named "__TRANSFORMED_BY_JAVASSIST_MAVEN_PLUGIN__" as the stamp. Any class overriding this method should also override applyStamp(IClassTransformer, CtClass) and removeStamp(IClassTransformer, CtClass).

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations must not be null.
        candidateClass - the class to check must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the class owns the stamp, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed candidateClass is null.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        CtClass.getDeclaredField(String)

      • createStampFieldName

        private String createStampFieldName(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer)
        Creates the name of the stamp field.

        This implementation appends "__TRANSFORMED_BY_JAVASSIST_MAVEN_PLUGIN__" with the full qualified class name and replaces all non-word characters (like '.') with '_'.

        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations must not be null.
        Returns:
        never null or empty.

      • createStampField

        private javassist.CtField createStampField(javassist.build.IClassTransformer transformer,
                                           javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                                    throws javassist.CannotCompileException
        Creates a CtField instance associated with the passed candidateClass.
        Parameters:
        transformer - The transformer that will apply transformations must not be null.
        candidateClass - must not be null
        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if passed candidateClass is null.
        javassist.CannotCompileException - field could not created
        See Also:
        CtField
